snippet: Andy Murray fended off a late rally by Novak Djokovic to win his first Grand Slam title and become the first man from Britain to do so since 1936.
abstract: Andy Murray defeats Novak Djokovic, 7-6, to win the men's United States Open, becoming the first British man to capture a Grand Slam singles championship since Fred Perry in 1936; match lasted 4 hours 53 minutes, tying the record for the longest Open final set in 1988.
lead_paragraph: Andy Murray fended off a late rally by Novak Djokovic to win his first Grand Slam title and become the first man from Britain to do so since 1936.

headline.seo: Andy Murray Beats Novak Djokovic for U.S. Open Title
headline.main: Marathon Ends Drought for Murray and Britain
headline.print_headline: Marathon Ends Drought for Murray and Britain
